Module WitchHunt
Package fr.sos.witchhunt.controller.core

Class Game

java.lang.Object
fr.sos.witchhunt.controller.core.Game
public final class Game extends Object

Core class giving access to the game and its options.

Instantiated by class Application, as a Singleton using the static method. Can be accessed globally, exposing its public and non-static members, using the same method. Game options are supposed to be checked by the model this way.

Gives access to the Main Menu, which is the entry point to the game options menu and lets the user start the match.

See Also:
  • Singleton design pattern
  • getInstance()
  • gotoMainMenu()
  • options()
  • Tabletop

    • tabletop

      private Tabletop tabletop

      Object representing the match and controlling its flow.

      The match is started using this object's startMatch() method.

      See Also:
      • Tabletop

    • sleepingAllowed

      private boolean sleepingAllowed
      Boolean option. If set to true, a delay is simulated between after each game action.

      Default : true.

      See Also:
      • User can change its value using the game options menu
      • Tabletop::freeze(int)

    • displayCPUStrategyChange

      private boolean displayCPUStrategyChange
      Boolean option. If set to true, the view will display any change in a CPU Player's strategy.

      Default : false.

      See Also:
      • User can change its value using the game options menu
      • CPUPlayer::chooseStrategy()

      A reference to the unique instance of this class.

    • exit

      public void exit()
      Exits the game. Called from the main menu.
      See Also:
      • gotoMainMenu()

    • gotoMainMenu

      public void gotoMainMenu()

      Displays the game's main menu and lets the user choose between :

      - Starting a new match

      - Going to the options menu

      - Exiting the application

      See Also:
      • Menu
      • DisplayMediator::displayMenu(Menu)
      • InputMediator::makeChoice(Menu)
      • The match is instantiated as a Singleton and started in its own thread.
      • options()
      • exit()

    • options

      private void options()

      Displays the game options menu.

      The user can modify the following options :

      - Simulated delay between game actions

      - display changes in a CPU Player's strategy.

      See Also:
      • Menu
      • DisplayMediator::displayMenu(Menu)
      • InputMediator::makeChoice(Menu)
      • sleepingAllowed
      • displayCPUStrategyChange
